block.p: Jessica Brand Liberman and Keith Todd Wilcox were married yesterday evening at the Montauk Yacht Club in Montauk, N.Y. Judge Debra Freeman of Federal District Court in Manhattan officiated.
The bride and bridegroom, both 35, met in prekindergarten at Hunter College Elementary School in Manhattan.
Jessica Brand Liberman and Keith Todd Wilcox were married yesterday evening at the Montauk Yacht Club in Montauk, N.Y. Judge Debra Freeman of Federal District Court in Manhattan officiated.
The bride and bridegroom, both 35, met in prekindergarten at Hunter College Elementary School in Manhattan.
The bride is a lawyer at Moody's Investors Service in Manhattan. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, where she also received her law degree cum laude.

She is a daughter of Micheline Blum of Manhattan and Donald B. Liberman of Garfield, N.J. Her father is a lawyer. Her mother is the president of Blum & Weprin Associates, a public opinion research firm in Manhattan. The bride is the stepdaughter of Dr. Michael Jaker.
The bridegroom is a Ph.D. candidate in marketing at Baruch College, from which he graduated. He also received an M.B.A. from the University of California.
He is a son of Venoris M. Wilcox of Manhattan and the late Ronald M. Wilcox. His father was the chief of psychology at the Veterans Affairs Medical Center in Manhattan.
